page.title: 01AN AREA SUMMARY, HERNE BAY
page.content: AN AREA SUMMARY, HERNE BAY On June 28th 1985 Herne Bay celebrated 150 years since an Act of Parliament gave permission for the development of the area which had formerly been a fairly open stretch of coastline.The area in this Domesday Block includes the first and most important areas of the new town to be developed namely the two shallow bays of the seafront and the two main commercial streets. Much of the early development of the town was as a seaside resort catering for visitors from London, and to facilitate this a pier had been started in 1831 so that steamers too big to enter the bay could still unload their passengers. Seaside attractions and tall boarding houses were developed, but as people's holiday habits have changed so has the character of Herne Bay's seafront.
